sets.name: Special Attacker
sets.description:
Solar Power should only be used on sun teams, as it's virtually useless otherwise. Tera Blast should be used with Tera Steel to reliably beat Carbink.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Weather Setter
sets.description:
Thunder Wave supports teammates that are still rather slow even under rain or sun like Beartic and Scovillain, respectively. Taunt denies entry hazards, recovery, and status moves. Haze neutralizes setup sweepers like Masquerain, Lilligant, and Hisuian Sliggoo.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Defensive
sets.description:
This spread provides similar defensive properties to 252 HP / 200 Def / 56 Spe but with slightly lower HP to improve Pain Split's effectiveness. 56 Speed EVs let it outspeed Adamant/Modest Honchkrow, Adamant/Modest Flapple, Timid Glimmet, and base Speed Drakloak.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Dragon Dance
sets.description:
The investment in bulk lets Pupitar avoid being OHKOed by Raichu's Surf from full after Stealth Rock and makes Jolly Honchkrow's Night Slash only a 3HKO. 152 Speed EVs allow Pupitar to outrun Raichu at +2. Stone Edge is stronger than Rock Slide but has less PP and lower accuracy. Tera Dragon and Tera Water both patch up Pupitar's Water weakness, but the former also lets it resist Grass- and Electric-type attacks while the latter helps more against Ice-type attacks.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Nasty Plot
sets.description:
136 Speed EVs let Grumpig outspeed Modest Glaceon. 44 SpA EVs allow unboosted Tera Ground Grumpig to KO offensive Skuntank with Earth Power after Stealth Rock damage.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Physically Offensive
sets.description:
Tera Blast should only be used if Skuntank opts for Tera Ground; this allows it to nail Steel-types like Perrserker and Tinkatuff, Hisuian Qwilfish, and opposing Skuntank.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Wish
sets.description:
X-Scissor hits opposing Grass-types like Flapple and Gogoat; if these Pokemon aren't a concern, Leafeon can run Yawn to force switches, Leech Seed for additional recovery, or Swords Dance to make up for its relative passivity.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

Basculin.overview: Note: Despite the two variants being very similar, Basculin-Blue-Striped is generally considered superior due to having access to two viable abilities (Adaptability and Rock Head), which makes it harder for your opponent to predict which set you're using.

sets.name: Defensive Spikes
sets.description:
Stone Edge threatens Fire- and Flying-types like Charizard, Vespiquen, and Honchkrow. Poison Jab prevents Quilladin from being walled by opposing Grass-types, such as Gogoat and Lilligant. Leech Seed offers additional recovery and decreases how often Quilladin needs to use Synthesis. Tera Rock helps against the aforementioned Fire- and Flying-types on top of powering up Stone Edge, but Tera Ghost can be used instead for spinblocking.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Wish Passer
sets.description:
The Speed investment lets Dachsbun outrun neutral-natured Honchkrow. An alternative EV spread is 252 HP / 60 Def / 132 SpD / 64 Spe, which, with an Impish nature, allows Dachsbun to OHKO Hasty Houndoom with Body Press while still checking special attackers.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!

sets.name: Sun Sweeper
sets.description:
Scovillain should only use a Mild nature with 4 Attack EVs if it's running Stomping Tantrum; otherwise, it should opt for a Modest nature, invest the leftover EVs in Defense, and run 0 Attack IVs.

Sample set. Stay tuned for updates!
